page.title: 08HOUSING IN CRANHAM
page.content: Upminster is a middle-class area,and most people move here because on the train it only takes 20-25 minutes to London. Most houses in Upminster are privately owned,and the most popular type of house is a 3{BEDROOMED SEMI-DETACHED house.There are a few{COUNCIL ESTATES and half a dozen blocks of flats near the town centre. Early growth was due to the coming of the railway in late Victorian/early Edwardian times.Away from the C.B.D. most of Upminster's houses were built between 1913-1940 and in Cranham between1950-1960.Recent growth is limited by the{GREENBELT ACT. There are roughly 10,000 houses in Upminster and the{AVERAGE PRICE}is Â£75,000.Prices range from Â£35,000 to Â£225,000.
